intro: Specklinia gehrtii, commonly known as the Hawaiian fernbrom. It is a rare and endemic species native to the Hawaiian Islands, specifically found on the island of Maui. This plant belongs to the Polypodiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like fronds. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, typically growing on rocky substrates or in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
